sentences.en: " Oh, Captain Randall, don't scold them!
sentences.cn: " 唔, 兰德尔队长, 请不要责备他们!

sentences.en: Do not scold the puppy, but simply and firmly say ‘no’.
sentences.cn: 不要责骂小狗，但要干脆利落地说“不”。

sentences.en: Don't scold her -- she's too young to understand.
sentences.cn: 别责备她, 她太小不懂事.

sentences.en: Don't scold her, she's nothing but a child.
sentences.cn: 不要责骂她, 她只不过是个孩子.

sentences.en: Don't scold him too much; he is at best a child.
sentences.cn: 不要太责骂他; 他只不过是个孩子.

sentences.en: Don't scold him; it is not his fault.
sentences.cn: 不要骂他, 这不是他的错.

sentences.en: Don't scold the child. It's not his fault.
sentences.cn: 别责怪那孩子, 那不是他的过错.

sentences.en: Don't take any notice of the boy. If you scold him, he'll only start acting up.
sentences.cn: 不要理那孩子, 你要是责骂他, 他反倒会开始调皮捣蛋.

sentences.en: I couldn't bear that Mother should scold me in the face of my friends.
sentences.cn: 母亲当着我朋友们的面骂我,我受不了.

sentences.en: If he finds out, he'll scold me.
sentences.cn: 如果他知道了，肯定会责骂我的。

sentences.en: Mother's scold stabbed her to the heart.
sentences.cn: 妈妈的责骂刺伤了她的心.

sentences.en: She writes me often, if only to scold me because I haven't written to her.
sentences.cn: 她常来信，即使仅仅为了责怪我还没回信给她。

sentences.en: They protested to his stepmother, demanding that she scold him.
sentences.cn: 他们有一次居然在他继母的面前批评他的行动, 要她好好管教他.

sentences.en: You shouldn't scold him on the slightest pretence.
sentences.cn: 你不应该以一点点借口就责骂他.

trans.tran_en: to angrily criticize someone, especially a child, about something they have done
